com.st.st25sdk.type4a

Class Type4Tag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.NFCTag
      • com.st.st25sdk.type4a.Type4Tag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheInterface, CCFileInterface, NdefCommandInterface, Type4CommandInterface, SysFileInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Type4aTag, Type4bTag

    public class Type4Tag
extends NFCTag
implements CCFileInterface, SysFileInterface, NdefCommandInterface, Type4CommandInterface, CacheInterface
    Defines required methods to handle a NFC Forum Type4 tag

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Type4Tag.AccessStatus
      Lists type4 Access Status
      static class  Type4Tag.Type4FileType
      Lists existing Type4 file types

      • readData

        public byte[] readData(int offsetInBytes,
                       int sizeInBytes)
                throws STException
        This function reads some bytes from the NDEF file. It can be used when the caller wants to handle the file selection himself PREREQUISITE: The caller is responsible for selecting the NDEF file before calling this function
        Parameters:
        offsetInBytes - Offset in Bytes from the beginning of the file
        sizeInBytes - Number of Bytes to read
        Returns:
        the data read
        Throws:
        STException

        data - Number of Bytes to read

      • getNdefFileId

        public int getNdefFileId()
                  throws STException
        Get the FileId of the NDEF file. This NDEF file is mandatory for Type4 tags It is defined by the first TLV block of the CC File
        Returns:
        the ID of the first NDEF file
        Throws:
        STException

      • getFileIdList

        public int[] getFileIdList()
                    throws STException
        Returns the list of files defined in the TLV blocks of the CC File The returned list is a list of fileId A file can be a NDEF File or a Proprietary file. Use getFileType() to know the file Type
        Returns:
        the list of file IDs
        Throws:
        STException

      • _writeNdefMessage

        public void _writeNdefMessage(int fileId,
                              NDEFMsg msg)
                       throws STException
        This function writes a NDEF message into the NDEF file. It can be used when the caller wants to handle the file selection himself PREREQUISITE: The caller is responsible for selecting the NDEF file before calling this function WARNING: the Application is responsible for providing the fileId corresponding to the latest file selected, if not the cache may be in an unpredictable state
        Parameters:
        fileId - fileId selected by the application
        msg - NDEF message to write
        Throws:
        STException

      • _readNdefMessage

        public NDEFMsg _readNdefMessage(int fileId)
                         throws STException
        This function read a NDEF message from the NDEF file. It can be used when the caller wants to handle the file selection himself PREREQUISITE: The caller is responsible for selecting the NDEF file before calling this function
        Parameters:
        fileId - file selected by the application
        Returns:
        the NDEF message read as a NDEFMsg object
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int fileId,
                       int offsetInBytes,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        This function will do the following actions in an ATOMIC manner: - select the indicated file - write the requested bytes WARNING: After this write, the cache may not be aligned anymore with file's content so it is recommended to invalidate the cache
        Parameters:
        fileId - File identifier
        offsetInBytes - Offset in Bytes from the beginning of the file
        data - Data to write
        Throws:
        STException
